criteria: Application of Healthy Eating Choices in Social Settings
descriptions: Does not identify any healthy eating choices.
Identifies one or two healthy eating choices with significant inaccuracies.
Identifies some healthy eating choices but demonstrates a limited understanding of their benefits.
Identifies several healthy eating choices and shows a basic understanding of their benefits.
Identifies most healthy eating choices accurately and explains their benefits with some detail.
Consistently identifies a wide range of healthy eating choices and thoroughly explains their benefits and impact on health.
Unable to suggest healthy eating choices within friend and family contexts.
Suggests healthy eating choices with prompting but struggles to adapt them to social situations.
Suggests healthy eating choices in some social settings, but lacks consistency or adaptability.
Suggests healthy eating choices in common social settings, adapting choices reasonably well to the context.
Proactively suggests and adapts healthy eating choices in various social settings, demonstrating good awareness of social dynamics.
Expertly integrates and promotes healthy eating choices within diverse social settings, positively influencing friends and family.
Demonstrates no understanding of nutritional information (e.g., calories, macros, vitamins).
Demonstrates minimal understanding of nutritional information with significant misconceptions.
Understands basic nutritional information but struggles to apply it to food choices.
Understands and applies nutritional information to make some informed food choices.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of nutritional information and uses it to consistently make healthy food choices.
Demonstrates comprehensive understanding of nutritional information and uses it to optimize food choices for health and well-being, educating others in the process.
